title: US teen inventor wins awards for technology that could save kids’ lives | The Star
meta_description: Pranavh Joshua Vallabhaneni and his family were preparing for a new addition – Pranavh’s baby brother – and it got his inventive juices flowing.
main_content: US teen inventor wins awards for technology that could save kids’ lives By Marc Narducci Technology Wednesday, 09 Sep 2020 11:30 AM MYT Related News AI 1d ago OpenAI unveils technology for ‘natural conversation’ World 1d ago Southern African countries urged to harness technology to boost inter-regional trade Technology 26 Feb 2025 21 federal technology staffers resign rather than help Elon Musk and DOGE slash size of US government Pranavh Joshua Vallabhaneni with his Baby Saver prototype invention at his home. He won first place in his grade category and also the Safety Award for his invention, Baby Saver – Hot Car Alert Device from Invention Convention Worldwide. — The Philadelphia Inquirer/TNS PHILADELPHIA: Pranavh Joshua Vallabhaneni and his family were preparing for a new addition – Pranavh’s baby brother – and it got his inventive juices flowing. “My parents were shopping for car seats and other baby products,” said Pranavh, 15, who is entering his sophomore year at Unionville High School in Kennett Square, Philadelphia. “I realised that there was a lot of emphasis on child safety.” Already a subscriber?
